meanings.definition: The quality or state of being systematic.
meanings.sent1: Her systematicnesses in planning the project ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lectures were known for their systematicnesses, making it easy for students to follow along.
meanings.sent3: The systematicnesses of the squirrel in organizing its nuts was quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: The systematicnesses of the ant colony's operations could teach us a lot about teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The systematicnesses of the library's cataloging system made finding books a breeze.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of following a system or method.
meanings.sent1: The team's success was due to their systematicnesses in following the coach's strategy.
meanings.sent2: His systematicnesses in approaching problems helped him find solutions quickly.
meanings.sent3: The systematicnesses of the robot in completing tasks was both impressive and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her systematicnesses in time management was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The systematicnesses of the assembly line ensured each product was made efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or arranging in a systematic way.
meanings.sent1: The systematicnesses of the event planner were evident in every detail of the party.
meanings.sent2: His systematicnesses in arranging the files made it easy to locate any document.
meanings.sent3: The systematicnesses of the cat in arranging its toys was both cute and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her systematicnesses in setting up the experiment was like watching a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The systematicnesses of the gardener in planting the flowers created a beautiful display.
